original: Karlson, Karl Gustaf (K. G.), professor, civilingenjör, Göteborg, f. 18/ 4/84 i Örby, Älvsb. 1., av insp. Oscar Carlsson o. Helena Carlsdotter. G. 18 m. Dagmar Petterson. Barn: Britta f. 20, Kerstin 22, Inger 26. — Chalmers Tekniska Läroanstalt (M) 99-04, Polytechn. i Zürich 04-06. Ritare v. A-B Gustaf Ericsisonis Automo-bilfaibr. i Sthilim 06-07, v. järnv :styr. maskinbyrå 07-08, ångtekn. v. A-B Ljungströms Angturbin 08-12, beräk-n :ing. h. Sv. A-B Gasaccumulator 12 -14, ångtekn. v. A-B de Lavals Angturbin 14-18, konstr. v. A-B Enoch Thulins Aeroplanfabr. (sederm. A-B Thulinverken) i Landskr. 18-20, be-räkn:ing. v. A-B de Lavals Angturbin 20-26, konstr. o. avdxhef där 26-34, prof. i ångteknik v. CTH 34, efter kail- lelse i maskinelement 43, högsk. prorektor sed. 43. Skr.: Maskinelement (i De tekn. vetenskap., 23), ett st. ant. vetenskapl. o. pop :vetenskapl. upps. o. ref. Medred. av Ur prof. Johan Erik Cederbloms efterlämnade papper 20. LIVA, dess mindre GM 24.
translated:
Karlson, Karl Gustaf (K. G.), professor, civil engineer, Gothenburg, born 18/04/84 in Örby, Älvsborgs län, son of inspector Oscar Carlsson and Helena Carlsdotter. Married in 1918 to Dagmar Petterson. Children: Britta, born in 1920; Kerstin, born in 1922; Inger, born in 1926. 

Attended Chalmers University of Technology from 1899 to 1904 and Polytechnic Institute in Zurich from 1904 to 1906. Worked as a draftsman at A-B Gustaf Ericsisonis Automobile Factory in Stockholm from 1906 to 1907, and at the railway control machine bureau from 1907 to 1908. Worked in steam technology at A-B Ljungströms Turbine from 1908 to 1912, as an engineer at Swedish A-B Gasaccumulator from 1912 to 1914, and in steam technology at A-B de Lavals Turbine from 1914 to 1918. 

Involved in construction at A-B Enoch Thulin's Aircraft Factory (later A-B Thulinverken) in Landskrona from 1918 to 1920, in calculation at A-B de Lavals Turbine from 1920 to 1926, and as a designer and head of department there from 1926 to 1934. Became a professor of steam technology at Chalmers University of Technology in 1934 and was appointed professor of machine elements in 1943. Served as deputy rector of the university from 1943. 

Writings include "Machine Elements" (in The Technical Sciences, 1923) and several scientific and popular scientific papers and references. Co-editor of "Ur prof. Johan Erik Cederblom's Remaining Papers" in 1920. Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences, and its minor royal medal in 1924.

workExperience.name: A-B Enoch Thulin's Aircraft Factory (A-B Thulinverken)

honors.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences
